answers.answer: Hello playhersgame,Stress urinary incontinence is quite common in women often irrespective to whether the patient has had a hysterectomy. Changes in the pelvic floor anatomy is frequently the concern. The pelvic floor support structures can be damaged with childbirth, obesity, COPD, diabetes and loss of estrogen to name a few.  Best Wishes!Regards,Erich T. Wyckoff, MD, FACOG

question: I had a hysterectomy (partial) in 1998 when I was 25, where I was numb for about four years. Gradually I noticed that I wouIld leak when I sneezed, laughed hard, run etc... I have been seen by a urologist for dynamics and decided that physical therapy was appropiate. It helped some but eventially I moved to medication to help. I wanted to know is this common to have this problem after a hysterectomy?
title: incontinence
